alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Yakutat (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 16 at 12:39PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, the Situk River near Yakutat * WHEN...Until 100 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1235 PM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing, especially near the Situk River, Tawa Creek, and the Lost River. Between 3 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Areas around 9 mile bridge, near Tawa Creek, and the Lost River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Situk River near Yakutat: At 11:30am the stage was 72.03 feet. Flood Stage is 71.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 71.8 feet is expected around 4:00pm Sunday. Impacts: At 70.5 feet: Bankfull stage. At 71.5 feet: Minor flooding is expected near 9 mile bridge with water beginning to encroach and flood the boat launch along with the surrounding campground. The Lost River and Tawa Creek will begin to go over their banks. At 72.2 feet: Minor flooding is expected near the 9 mile bridge and surrounding campground/boat launch. There will be significant erosion of the trail system along the Situk River. Water up to one foot will flow over the low spots on Forest highway #10, Cannon Beach Rd, near Tawa Creek and Lost River. Water will start to encroach the east end of the runway of the airport. Endicott Rd and Glacier Bear Rd will be flooded.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
